ratings.question_text: I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: What is the name of your TA?
comments: Juishan Yong
Shan Yong
Jui Shan Yong

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-10, if you wish
comments: Question 9- This course had a many exercises that took place outside of normal class hours. I learned a great deal from these exercises, and nearly all of them ran very smoothly.

The course was good for what it was - an introductory course in environmental design. That said, I think it was (far) below the graduate level and should be made much more challenging if it is to be kept a part of the FES curriculum. I took an enviro design course in undergrad and we actually read many of the texts referenced (cradle to cradle, biomimicry, etc.). I guess this was more of a "survey" course but I feel like I didn't get much out of it, unfortunately. I took it to fill an MEM distribution requirement. That said, the professor was very good at explaining the material, and was clearly invested in the class and his students. I know that he knows much more detailed info about the subject matter - I wish we'd gotten to tap into that!
Being given an opportunity to think creatively in and engineering course.

The in-class activities were interesting and provided a nice complement to the lectures. The disassembly activity was particularly fascinating. I also found the lectures to be extremely well-organized and easy-to-follow. The professor was always very well-prepared and made the class an enjoyable learning experience.

narratives.question_text: The things about this course most in need of improvement are:
comments: A slightly larger project budget would allow us to be more creative with our final projects.
While the assignments were a helpful complement to the lectures, they tended to be rather time-consuming and a little too open-ended.

narratives.question_text: What was the availability and quality of help you received of the instructor and TA?
comments: Excellent.
Both the instructor and TA provided excellent help and were extremely available to the students.
great

narratives.question_text: Discuss if you wish how this course fits into your overall program.
comments: This course provided an introduction to many of the fields of green engineering that I otherwise would not have studied during my time at Yale. It basically serves as an overview of the entire design process, providing multiple perspectives.
i just took it to fill an MEM distribution requirement

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: It was enjoyable and very interesting.

While this course does not directly fit into my academic program (environmental economics and implications for sustainable development), out of sheer curiosity, I wanted to have some exposure to green design.
i just took it to fill an MEM distribution requirement

narratives.question_text: Did it live up to your expectations?
comments: Absolutely
Yes.

narratives.question_text: Did you get out of it what you expected?
comments: Yes, it did
Yes.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: The group work was an essential component of the course. Designers usually work in groups, so the class reflected industry practices in this manner. I enjoyed working with my group, and it's difficult to imagine the course without that dynamic.
Fun! Great group led to creative brainstorming and creative teamwork that enhanced the experience.

For the in-class group work, I did find some assigned group members to be rather abrasive and difficult to work with (it was particularly frustrating to have most of the hands-on part of the disassembly exercise be done by one male). However, the voluntarily selected group for the semester design project provided a wonderful experience. We complemented each other very well and by scheduling weekly meetings and check-ins were able to complete the coursework efficiently and on-time.

narratives.question_text: For students taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: This course provides a broad overview of the field of green engineering. If you are already an expert in this field, the course may not be appropriate for you. But if you want a useful and enjoyable summary with an opportunity to apply the skills you learn, then this course is great.
